public interface IPreserveState

This interface is required by any class that uses the ObjectState class to preserve state information. State information allows a user to preserve object settings after closing the program.

Field Summary
static boolean DEFAULT
          "true" - This variable is used as a parameter for the getObjectState() method.
static boolean PROJECT
          "false" - This variable is used as a parameter for the getObjectState() method.
 
Method Summary
 ObjectState getObjectState(boolean is_default)
          This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object.
 void setObjectState(ObjectState new_state)
          This method will set the current state variables of the object to state variables wrapped in the ObjectState passed in.
 

Field Detail

DEFAULT

static final boolean DEFAULT
"true" - This variable is used as a parameter for the getObjectState() method. Use this variable if the state returned is to store user preferences, those things common from project to project.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROJECT

static final boolean PROJECT
"false" - This variable is used as a parameter for the getObjectState() method. Use this variable if the state returned is to project specific preferences, things such as image selections.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

setObjectState

void setObjectState(ObjectState new_state)
This method will set the current state variables of the object to state variables wrapped in the ObjectState passed in.

Parameters:
new_state -

getObjectState

ObjectState getObjectState(boolean is_default)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Parameters:
is_default - True if default state, use static variable.
Returns:
if true, the selective default state, else the state for with all possible saved values.
